definitions.definition: The dispersion of a group in a manner comparable to that of the Jews among the Gentiles after the Babylonian captivity (6th century BCE ).
examples: The African diaspora caused a melding of cultures, both African cultures and Western ones, in many places.

definitions.definition: Jews outside of the land of Israel .
The regions where such a dispersed group (especially the Jews) resides, taken collectively.
examples: Jews in the diaspora often have a different perspective on anti-Semitism than Israeli Jews.

definitions.definition: Any dispersion of an originally homogeneous entity , such as a language or culture .

main_definition: ( collective ) The dispersion of a group in a manner comparable to that of the Jews among the Gentiles after the Babylonian captivity (6th century BCE ).
secondary_definitions: ( by extension, informal ) Jews outside of the land of Israel .
The regions where such a dispersed group (especially the Jews) resides, taken collectively.
Any dispersion of an originally homogeneous entity , such as a language or culture .
